sen.j: 大将軍（だいしょうぐん）は陰陽道において方位の吉凶を司る八将神（はっしょうじん）の一。
sen.e: "Daishogun" (commander-in-chief) is one of the Hasshojin (eight general gods) who is responsible for the fortune of directions in Onmyodo (way of Yin and Yang; occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements).

sen.j: 古代中国では明けの明星を啓明、宵の明星を長庚または太白（たいはく）と呼び、軍事を司る星神とされたが、それが日本の陰陽道に取り入れられ、太白神や金神（こんじん）・大将軍となった。
sen.e: In ancient China, the morning star was called and Keimei and the evening star was called Choko or Taihaku, and was considered the star gods responsible for military affairs, and this was adopted by Onmyodo in Japan and became Taihakujin,Konjin, and Daishogun.

sen.e: All were star gods related to Venus, and gogyo-setsu (the theory of five elements) led them to knives, which made them feared in terms of almanac and orientation as Araburu Kami (malignant gods).
